slides.title: Introduction to Time & Work
slides.content:
**Time & Work** problems deal with the relationship between the time taken to complete a task and the amount of work done.

**Key Concept:** Work = Time × Rate

**Example:** If A can complete a task in 10 days, then in 1 day A completes 1/10 of the work.

slides.title: Basic Formula
slides.content:
**If A can do a work in 'n' days:**
- Work done by A in 1 day = 1/n

**If A and B work together:**
- Combined work in 1 day = 1/a + 1/b

**Time taken together:**
Time = 1 / (1/a + 1/b) = (a×b)/(a+b)

slides.title: Work & Efficiency
slides.content:
**Efficiency:** Rate of doing work

**If A is twice as efficient as B:**
- Time taken by A : Time taken by B = 1 : 2

**Example:** If A takes 10 days and B takes 20 days, A is twice as efficient as B.

slides.title: Work & Wages
slides.content:
**Wages are distributed in ratio of work done**

**Formula:**
Wages ratio = Work ratio = Efficiency ratio

**Example:** If A does 2/5 of work and B does 3/5, wages are distributed in ratio 2:3
